channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Tatsuya Nakadai, Japanese Star Known for ‘Ran’ and Other Classics, Dies at 92
item.description: He was a fixture of postwar Japanese cinema and starred in films by Akira Kurosawa and other directors of that era.

item.title: These current Fortune 500 CEOs have served in the armed forces, including a foreign military
item.description: As Americans observe Veterans Day, here's a look at current Fortune 500 CEOs who have served in the military.

item.title: Police Investigate Deadly New Delhi Blast as Possible Terrorist Attack
item.description: India’s prime minister, Narendra Modi, said the “conspirators” behind an explosion that killed at least eight people would be brought to justice.

item.title: New York City business leaders are split on whether to relocate their firms to avoid Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani’s policies
item.description: None have announced definitive plans to do so, but some business leaders say they’re considering moving out.

item.title: Air Force veteran says cybersecurity is a natural career transition for civilian life—and it’s a field with more than 500,000 open jobs
item.description: A veteran has been trained to think like an adversary, says Air Force veteran Frankie Sclafani.

item.title: Warren Buffett admits his Giving Pledge philanthropy was not ‘feasible’—he’s instead left his three kids $500 million a year to give away
item.description: The Berkshire Hathaway billionaire says his longevity has led to “unavoidable consequences” for his charitable objectives.

item.title: Asian travel platform Klook is filing for a New York IPO
item.description: Klook revealed that it generated $417.1 million in revenue in 2024, a 24% increase. Yet the company isn’t profitable, losing $99.3 million last year.

item.title: 2025 Booker Prize Goes to David Szalay’s ‘Flesh’
item.description: The rags-to-riches tale had already made fans of Zadie Smith and Dua Lipa. Roddy Doyle, who chaired the judging panel, called the book “singular” and ...

item.title: Late Night Is Disappointed in Democrats Over Shutdown Deal
item.description: “Our long national nightmare is different,” Stephen Colbert said after some Democratic senators voted with Republicans to end the government shutdown.

item.title: ‘It Feels Like I’m in a Nightmare’: Inside the First Deportation Flight to Iran
item.description: For decades, Iranians fleeing persecution have found protection in the United States. But this fall, the Trump administration deported a planeload of ...

item.title: India Is Investigating a Deadly Car Explosion. Here’s What to Know.
item.description: The car exploded near a metro station in a historic part of New Delhi on Monday night. Officials are investigating and security is tight around the re...

item.title: The BBC Under Fire
item.description: President Trump is threatening to sue, and that’s just one of the broadcaster’s problems.

item.title: Police Investigate Deadly New Delhi Blast as Possible Terrorist Attack
item.description: India’s prime minister, Narendra Modi, said the “conspirators” behind an explosion that killed at least eight people would be brought to justice.

item.title: These Sheep Have a Statement to Make
item.description: How fashion connected a designer, a farmer, Grindr and a herd of male-oriented rams.

item.title: Use A.I. to Reinvigorate Democracy — Not Replace It
item.description: Governments shouldn’t hand over decision-making to A.I.
